commit_message:
Document the new RHSM/Ansible interface

Co-Authored-By: Dan Macpherson <dmacpher@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I01a4d304e09b99d8ffe7aede0a9c87a44132d024
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/24/545524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Deploying with RHSM =================== Summary ------- Starting in the Queens release, it is possible to use Ansible to apply the RHSM (Red Hat Subscription management) configuration. Instead of the pre_deploy rhel-registration script, the new RHSM service will allow our operators to: #. deploy advanced rhsm configurations, where each role can have their own repositories for example. #. use config-download mechanism so operators can run the playbooks at anytime after the deployment, in case RHSM parameters have changed. Using RHSM ---------- To enable deployment with Ansible and config-download pass the additional arg to the deployment command:: openstack overcloud deploy \ <other cli args> \ -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/config-download-environment.yaml \ --config-download -e ~/rhsm.yaml The ``rhsm.yaml`` environment enables mapping the OS::TripleO::Services::Rhsm to the extraconfig service:: resource_registry: OS::TripleO::Services::Rhsm: /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/extraconfig/services/rhsm.yaml parameter_defaults: RhsmVars: rhsm_repos: - rhel-7-server-rpms - rhel-7-server-extras-rpms - rhel-ha-for-rhel-7-server-rpms - rhel-7-server-openstack-13-rpms - rhel-7-server-rhceph-3-mon-rpms - rhel-7-server-rhceph-3-tools-rpms rhsm_activation_key: 'secrete-key' In some advanced use cases, you might want to configure RHSM for a specific role:: parameter_defaults: ComputeHCIParameters: RhsmVars: rhsm_repos: - rhel-7-server-rpms - rhel-7-server-extras-rpms - rhel-ha-for-rhel-7-server-rpms - rhel-7-server-openstack-13-rpms - rhel-7-server-rhceph-3-osd-rpms - rhel-7-server-rhceph-3-mon-rpms - rhel-7-server-rhceph-3-tools-rpms rhsm_activation_key: 'anothersecrete-key' In that case, all nodes deployed with ComputeHCI will be configured with these RHSM parameters. Transition from previous method ------------------------------- The previous method uses a script called rhel-registration which is called during pre_deploy step. While the script is still working, a migration can be done by using the new service and replacing parameters used in rhel-registration by RhsmVars and the new rhsm service with Ansible. +------------------------------+------------------------------+ | rhel-registration script | rhsm with Ansible (RhsmVars) | +==============================+==============================+ | rhel_reg_activation_key | rhsm_activation_key | +------------------------------+------------------------------+ | rhel_reg_auto_attach | rhsm_autosubscribe | +------------------------------+------------------------------+ | rhel_reg_sat_url | rhsm_satellite_url | +------------------------------+------------------------------+ | rhel_reg_org | rhsm_org_id | +------------------------------+------------------------------+ | rhel_reg_password | rhsm_password | +------------------------------+------------------------------+ | rhel_reg_repos | rhsm_repos | +------------------------------+------------------------------+ | rhel_reg_pool_id | rhsm_pool_ids | +------------------------------+------------------------------+ | rhel_reg_user | rhsm_username | +------------------------------+------------------------------+ | rhel_reg_method | rhsm_method | +------------------------------+------------------------------+ | rhel_reg_http_proxy_host | rhsm_rhsm_proxy_hostname | +------------------------------+------------------------------+ | rhel_reg_http_proxy_port | rhsm_rhsm_proxy_port | +------------------------------+------------------------------+ | rhel_reg_http_proxy_username | rhsm_rhsm_proxy_user | +------------------------------+------------------------------+ | rhel_reg_http_proxy_password | rhsm_rhsm_proxy_password | +------------------------------+------------------------------+ More about the Ansible role --------------------------- TripleO is using the Ansible role_ for Red Hat Subscription. .. _role: https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-redhat-subscription You can find all available parameters in this repository.

Remove Initial Committee section

Now that the UC is a fully elected body there is no need for this
section any longer.

Change-Id: Ia85a01030b11f1ade29fec47aeff89232bff5763
Signed-off-by: Melvin Hillsman <mrhillsman@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance-uc refs/changes/73/549873/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Initial Committee ================= The current UC will serve as UC until the elections in Spring 2017. At that point, the current three UC members who still had 6 months to serve get a 6-month seat, and an election is run to determine the other two members. Candidates ranking 1st and 2nd would get one-year seats. Fall 2017 elections should see the normal renewal of 3 seats for one-year period.

If enabled (disabled by default), we can now manage
/etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf file.

Change-Id: I58bc42c9a6cfe187d10eb2e882d8cc56496eca9b

commit_message:
Configure /etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf when Ironic is enabled.

For feature parity with the containerized undercloud, we will configure
/etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf when Ironic is enabled, configure dhcp-match and
dhcp-option-force and the MTU by re-using NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu parameter.

The patch uses service_config_settings in ironic-conductor service, to
configure /etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf and the Neutron DHCP Agent.
The reason of this way to do is because it'll be transparent for the
end-user when deploying a containerized Ironic + Neutron (which is what
we have on the undercloud as non-containerized).

In fact, the dnsmasq.conf was previously managed by instack-undercloud
and will now be managed by THT and used on the containerized-undercloud.

Depends-On: I58bc42c9a6cfe187d10eb2e882d8cc56496eca9b
Change-Id: I035cba7f88fda5adde816a32470fbbbad4da7d08
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/50/546050/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu: type: number default: 1500 description: | MTU of the underlying physical network. Neutron uses this value to calculate MTU for all virtual network components. For flat and VLAN networks, neutron uses this value without modification. For overlay networks such as VXLAN, neutron automatically subtracts the overlay protocol overhead from this value. service_config_settings: neutron_dhcp: tripleo::profile::base::neutron::dhcp::manage_dnsmasq: true neutron::agents::dhcp: '/etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf' neutron::dnsmasq::dhcp_match: 'dhcp-match=ipxe,175' neutron::dnsmasq::mtu: {get_param: NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu}

commit_message:
Introduce neutron::dnsmasq

... that will configure /etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf file, that can be used
by Neutron DHCP agent.
One use case it when deploying Ironic and when we want to enable ipxe
and configure specific MTU values, like we do in TripleO.

Change-Id: I07c8e3dc6926cf47915ec47d3f3e60b5d80b5f45

commit_message:
Add trusted option to apt mirrors

Since our Debian+Ubuntu mirrors are unsigned, we need to set the
"trusted" option on them in order to allow newer apt versions to pull
updates from them.

Test the change on base-test playbook first.

Change-Id: Ie20a68aa0a39163f1310ab3e22eaddcfb9704544
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/549162

commit_message:
Adds two profiles mellon and openidc for keystone. These modules are
required for keystone to support OpenID Connect and SAML auth.

Change-Id: I8b9a8563d2aeedb8d76b71ced0b7f1bf95744939
Implements: Adds required apache 2 modules for keystone external SSO
Closes-Bug: #1750679

commit_message:
Refactor lodash imports

This changes all lodash imports from the 'import * as _ from lodash' pattern to
using the 'import { ... } from 'lodash'' pattern.

This way our editors can have better autocompletion, and more importantly,
uglify can more effectively minify our code.

We recently got into the habit of using the new form.  This patch brings the
rest of the codebase up to that standard.

Change-Id: Idde3e1e44b53684a8880768c55777df54ad8b66a

commit_message:
Add support for libvirt VNC TLS

Configures certs/key for nova-novnc vencrypt when TLS is enabled on the
internal network. A dedicated IPA sub-CA can be used to restrict access,
however by default the main IPA CA is used.

Depends-On: Ic73bcbdbecc1bc05f43acdd5480370f37ead3fb8
Change-Id: I67ffd847dc2d1949833a9d7039ad51e4364e02da

InternalTLSVncCAFile: default: '/etc/ipa/vnc.crt' type: string description: Specifies the CA cert to use for VNC TLS. commit_message:
Fix races in conditionals tests

In convergence, resources have a tendency to appear and disappear in their
own time, not atomically with a change to the stack state. Therefore when
testing conditionals (i.e. looking for resources to appear/disappear) we
must be careful to take into account the states of the resources we find to
avoid race conditions.

Change-Id: I488921c6c4c3324912ded494db5ab9605becce9b
Closes-Bug: #1737796

commit_message:
RabbitMQ: persist stateful data to volume

This PS persists stateful data to volumes, allowing the cluster to
restart.

commit_message:
Remove self.__dict__ for formatting strings

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#dictionaries-lists.
It is not clear as using explicit dictionaries and help avoid some
errors during refactoring.

Change-Id: I06a2083a2635ed3103616de017331da158e330a3

commit_message:
use six.StringIO for compatibility with io.StringIO in python3

The newer version of six (1.4.1) provides six.StringIO
which is a fake file object for textual data. It's an
alias for cStringIO.StringIO, in python2 and io.StringIO
in Python3

Change-Id: I1888fcd7971d69ccb612200154150300ed14c712

Move kernel to setup stage

Because we're pulling packages and services in stages in the undercloud,
we need to move the kernel profile to the setup stage for the dependant
patch.

commit_message:
Ensure sysctl values are configured early on

Docker will attempt to configure iptables rules if it finds that
ip_forward is not enabled prior to the docker daemon getting started.
Since we want this not to happen, we need to make sure the sysctl values
are configured early on in the deployment. Currently the kernel options
are still run via puppet on the host so we can leverage the puppet
spaceship operator to ensure that they sysctl values are configured
before any package installations which would occur priot to services
being started.

Depends-On: I81ba7a493cf9a6ffd9ff7de91155be983b1ecdcb
Change-Id: Id2ca4441b98dd2e8582adb21f2c06b9d23c7a299
Related-Bug: #1750194
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/98/548398/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We should configure the sysctl options before we do anything else. # Specificaly this is to address things like LP#1750194 where docker will # try and update iptables rules if ip_forward is not enabled. Sysctl::Value<||> -> Package<||>

commit_message:
Temporarily add SUPER for glance user

A late change[0] in glance enabled the EMC actions as part of the
dbsync. This causes issues if the glance user does not have SUPER
permissions. This change temporarily enables SUPER permissions for
glance until a fix for this can be merged into glance.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433934/

Change-Id: I84ce57a98f64367c83ac632cbf3c0c2b6c1cdba8
Related-Bug: #1749641
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/43/546243/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Various improvements for rally-task-at-devstack job

* Move zuul configuration to .zuul.d directory. It allows to place job
  definitions into separate files (we have a lot of jobs).
* Copy `extra` files to the right folder
* Add check for rally results directory existance before fetching it
* Stop play if `rally task start` fails with unexpected error code
* Export RALLY_PLUGINS_DIR and RALLY_EXTRA_DIR environment variables
  before launching rally task, to provide backward compatibility.
  (see https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/master/rally-jobs/task-mistral.yaml#L1 )
* Save one line message about happened error
* Load custom plugins

Change-Id: I1004afb29b9c173e414c59ef54bf58458b5d9422

commit_message:
Ignore ironic nodes when registering compute nodes

We don't want to upgrade ironic overcloud nodes so this change
filters them out from the overcloud hypervisors list.

Change-Id: I2ad47415a7f9b28a9a73c178fea79f5fcb689096

commit_message:
Fix conditional for oooq ffu scenario transformation.

The current check gives that error[1]

   The conditional check 'upgrade_composable_scenario' failed. The
   error was: error while evaluating
   conditional (upgrade_composable_scenario): 'scenario001' is
   undefined

A working idiom here would be to test for non empty string as casting
value doesn't work.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/70/546670/18/experimental/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-multinode-ffu-upgrade/bd302c3/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-02-28_19_37_59_802230

Change-Id: Id6b9ef30f00cb4eef2cdf43110bd111e38e40084

commit_message:
Write only defined variables

If variable is not defined, it failes with set -u as
~/tripleo-ci/scripts/common_functions.sh: line 378: !VAR: unbound variable

This patch adds conditional logic to write only what's defined

Change-Id: Ibd1e7cc9eeb67b3dfdfc3b72af368c9c6796fb18
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/68/544068/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -z ${VAR+x} ]; then echo "Variable is not set" else echo "export $VAR=\"${!VAR}\"" >> $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/deploy.env fi

commit_message:
Revert "openstackdocstheme 1.19.0"

This reverts commit 2a38119e3c4b0eefacc47c02f52cd9e1990090a8.
It failed post-jobs (preventing the tag from happening) and
will need to be reenqueued).

Change-Id: I79daff0acae80ff39f37eb3d41e903417c2cc7fe

subject: Use aio_basekit scenario for OpenSUSE
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-02 20:21:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/f86d70a233925af889a2bb1d1c408aedb1c1095c', 'message': 'Use aio_basekit scenario for OpenSUSE

The aio_basekit scenario is helping the CentOS tests complete
more often and this could help the OpenSUSE tests as well.
This patch adds a non-voting gate test for OpenSUSE using the
aio_basekit scenario. It also disables the existing OpenSUSE
tests since they time out frequently.

Conflicts:
     zuul.d/project.yaml

commit_message:
Use aio_basekit scenario for OpenSUSE

The aio_basekit scenario is helping the CentOS tests complete
more often and this could help the OpenSUSE tests as well.
This patch adds a non-voting gate test for OpenSUSE using the
aio_basekit scenario. It also disables the existing OpenSUSE
tests since they time out frequently.

Conflicts:
     zuul.d/project.yaml

Change-Id: Ib4a80f7c67518029adf7c6c7bca7d4a95f3f43c9
(cherry picked from commit 9f36b2d171a8c3a38f151cdc1b59772a833264f8)

revisions:

commit_message:
CentOS 7 integrated gate optimization

The CentOS 7 AIO jobs time out fairly frequently in the gates and
this patch switches the jobs to use the new aio_basekit scenario in
the hopes that jobs will complete more often.

This patch also sets SELinux to Permissive mode for CentOS 7 gate
testing. This can be changed back to Enforcing when CentOS 7's
SELinux policies are ready.

This patch also sets package_state to present for CentOS 7 jobs. This
is a temporary measure to ensure more of the gate jobs can finish on
time and we can expose deployment issues in the gates.

(This backport fixes a cherry-pick conflict in project.yaml.)

Change-Id: Ic478a7402fee3df0667f0d6fd9a714688808b2ec
(cherry picked from commit f4bc81cff97e943a28d89213305e80f5a5ccac79)

other roles, including validating the checksum of the download.

subject: Implement always tag for required fact
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-24 17:09:45.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/lxc_cache_prestage.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/commit/92f78fe4387b1cfc1a055b12b2db73c41188aecf', 'message': "Implement always tag for required fact

The fact set for 'Set image index fact' is used
in the next task, which is tagged 'always' but
the fact setting is not. This breaks when using
tags.

Given that all the tasks in this file are set to
'always', this patch moves the tag setting to
the inclusion instead.

Change-Id: If319e749ef7cdfbbbd3d03096608fc736927f89d
"}]
commit_message:
Implement always tag for required fact

The fact set for 'Set image index fact' is used
in the next task, which is tagged 'always' but
the fact setting is not. This breaks when using
tags.

Given that all the tasks in this file are set to
'always', this patch moves the tag setting to
the inclusion instead.

Change-Id: If319e749ef7cdfbbbd3d03096608fc736927f89d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/71/547771/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Resource Class Affinity

This spec describes a limited but simple mechanism to support modeling
and exploiting NUMA via placement. The design does not attempt to solve
the entire issue of affinity and anti-affinity. Rather, it allows us to
address the majority of use cases in a way that’s easy to understand,
model, and use; and which does not restrict future development of an
all-encompassing generic affinity/anti-affinity solution.

The crux is the ability to declare, within a request for allocation
candidates, a list of resource classes whose resources must come from
providers in the same aggregate. Virt drivers implementing
update_provider_tree model each NUMA node as a branch off of the root
provider, associating each provider in the branch with a single
aggregate. Operators design flavors containing the list of the resource
classes which must come from the same NUMA node. The scheduler passes
that list to placement, which returns only allocation candidates which
conform to that restriction.

Change-Id: Ibab68cba3b2b38470676e7f7049d0c6610a4d937
blueprint: resource-class-affinity
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/62/543062/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================= Resource Class Affinity ======================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/resource-class-affinity This spec describes a limited but simple mechanism to support modeling and exploiting NUMA via placement. The design does not attempt to solve the entire issue of affinity and anti-affinity. Rather, it allows us to address the majority of use cases in a way that's easy to understand, model, and use; and which does not restrict future development of an all-encompassing generic affinity/anti-affinity solution. The crux is the ability to declare, within a request for allocation candidates, a list of resource classes whose resources must come from providers in the same aggregate. Virt drivers implementing `update_provider_tree`_ model each NUMA node as a branch off of the root provider, associating each provider in the branch with a single aggregate. Operators design flavors containing the list of the resource classes which must come from the same NUMA node. The scheduler passes that list to placement, which returns only allocation candidates which conform to that restriction. Problem description =================== Though the proposed design may turn out to be useful for other things, it mainly targets the current inability to model and exploit NUMA via placement. In simplified terms, an instance whose resources are provided from the same NUMA node enjoys performance benefits. `Nested Resource Providers`_ and `update_provider_tree`_ give the virt driver the ability to arrange resource providers logically into a hierarchy that gives the appearance of modeling NUMA. For example: .. code:: +-----------------+ | compute_node_rp | | (no inventory) | +-----------------+ / \ +-----------------+ +-----------------+ | NUMA1_rp | | NUMA2_rp | | VCPU: 8 | | VCPU: 8 | | MEMORY_MB: 8192 | | MEMORY_MB: 8192 | +-----------------+ +-----------------+ / \ / \ +-----------------+ +-----------------+ +-----------------+ +-----------------+ | NIC_PF1_rp | | NIC_PF2_rp | | NIC_PF3_rp | | NIC_PF4_rp | | SRIOV_NET_VF: 4 | | SRIOV_NET_VF: 4 | | SRIOV_NET_VF: 4 | | SRIOV_NET_VF: 4 | | CUSTOM_NET1 | | CUSTOM_NET2 | | CUSTOM_NET1 | | CUSTOM_NET2 | +-----------------+ +-----------------+ +-----------------+ +-----------------+ This models a compute with two NUMA nodes. Each NUMA node encompasses 8 VCPUs, 8GB of RAM, and two SR-IOV physical ports. The problem being addressed is that, although the virt driver can model this, there is as yet no (good) way for the user to express a request to deploy an instance whose resources are all provided by the same NUMA node. Use Cases --------- As an end user, I wish to deploy an instance whose resources have affinity to the same NUMA node. Proposed change =============== .. _`queryparam`: group_resources queryparam to GET /allocation_candidates -------------------------------------------------------- A new query parameter, ``group_resources``, is accepted by the `list allocation candidates`_ API (``GET /allocation_candidates``). The value is a comma-separated list of string resource class names (see `Examples`_). When it is specified, the API must return allocation candidates such that the listed resources come from providers in the same aggregate. .. For purposes of this feature, resources provided by the same *resource provider* are considered as coming from the same *aggregate*, even if that resource provider has no aggregate associations. ``group_resources`` only applies to the un-numbered request group, since a `numbered request group`_ is already restricted to a single resource provider. This design does not provide a way to affinitize resources from multiple request groups (though see `Numbered Request Group Affinity`_ for an alternative that does). Flavor Syntax ------------- Flavor extra_specs recognizes a new key with the exact same syntax as the queryparam. This is passed directly through to the placement query. See `Examples`_. Virt's Responsibilities ----------------------- A virt driver wishing to support this feature (whether for NUMA or something else) should implement `update_provider_tree`_ and model its compute node such that more than one resource provider has inventories in the same resource class(es). Then associate an aggregate UUID with each provider for which resource grouping is to be supported. See `Examples`_. .. If inventories in resource classes which need to be "groupable" are always together (same resource provider), no aggregate associations are necessary. Note that, while a certain amount of consistency in modeling among different virt drivers is encouraged and may eventually be enforced, this design imposes very little stricture in that regard. Scheduler --------- The scheduler needs to be enhanced to recognize the new queryparam in flavor extra_specs and build it into the ``GET /allocation_candidates`` query when selecting destinations for instance deployments. Examples -------- Expanding on the model in the `Problem description`_ to include aggregate associations: .. code:: +-----------------+ | compute_node_rp | | (no inventory) | +-----------------+ / \ +-----------------+ +-----------------+ | NUMA1_rp | | NUMA2_rp | | VCPU: 8 | | VCPU: 8 | | MEMORY_MB: 8192 | | MEMORY_MB: 8192 | | agg_numa_1 | | agg_numa_2 | +-----------------+ +-----------------+ / \ / \ +-----------------+ +-----------------+ +-----------------+ +-----------------+ | NIC_PF1_rp | | NIC_PF2_rp | | NIC_PF3_rp | | NIC_PF4_rp | | SRIOV_NET_VF: 4 | | SRIOV_NET_VF: 4 | | SRIOV_NET_VF: 4 | | SRIOV_NET_VF: 4 | | CUSTOM_NET1 | | CUSTOM_NET2 | | CUSTOM_NET1 | | CUSTOM_NET2 | | agg_numa_1 | | agg_numa_1 | | agg_numa_2 | | agg_numa_2 | +-----------------+ +-----------------+ +-----------------+ +-----------------+ **Example 1:** "Give me 2 VCPU and 1 GB of memory from the same NUMA node; and one VF from NET2 (which need not be from the same NUMA node)." **Flavor:** .. code:: resources:VCPU=2 resources:MEMORY_MB=1024 resources:SRIOV_NET_VF=1 trait:CUSTOM_NET2=required group_resources=VCPU,MEMORY_MB **Placement API request:** .. code:: GET /allocation_candidates?resources=VCPU:2,MEMORY_MB:1024,SRIOV_NET_VF:1 &required=CUSTOM_NET2 &group_resources=VCPU,MEMORY_MB **Allocation requests:** .. code:: [ { "allocations": { NUMA1_rp: { "resources": { "VCPU": 2, "MEMORY_MB": 1024, }} NIC_PF2_rp: { "resources": { "SRIOV_NET_VF": 1, }} }} { "allocations": { NUMA1_rp: { "resources": { "VCPU": 2, "MEMORY_MB": 1024, }} NIC_PF4_rp: { "resources": { "SRIOV_NET_VF": 1, }} }} { "allocations": { NUMA2_rp: { "resources": { "VCPU": 2, "MEMORY_MB": 1024, }} NIC_PF2_rp: { "resources": { "SRIOV_NET_VF": 1, }} }} { "allocations": { NUMA2_rp: { "resources": { "VCPU": 2, "MEMORY_MB": 1024, }} NIC_PF4_rp: { "resources": { "SRIOV_NET_VF": 1, }} }} ] **Example 2:** "Give me 2 VCPU, 1GB of memory, and one VF from NET2, all from the same NUMA node" **Flavor:** .. code:: resources:VCPU=2 resources:MEMORY_MB=1024 resources:SRIOV_NET_VF=1 trait:CUSTOM_NET2=required group_resources=VCPU,MEMORY_MB,SRIOV_NET_VF **Placement API request:** .. code:: GET /allocation_candidates?resources=VCPU:2,MEMORY_MB:1024,SRIOV_NET_VF:1 &required=CUSTOM_NET2 &group_resources=VCPU,MEMORY_MB,SRIOV_NET_VF **Allocation requests:** .. code:: [ { "allocations": { NUMA1_rp: { "resources": { "VCPU": 2, "MEMORY_MB": 1024, }} NIC_PF2_rp: { "resources": { "SRIOV_NET_VF": 1, }} }} { "allocations": { NUMA2_rp: { "resources": { "VCPU": 2, "MEMORY_MB": 1024, }} NIC_PF4_rp: { "resources": { "SRIOV_NET_VF": 1, }} }} ] Limitations ----------- This design doesn't solve the world. Things it can't express: Anti-affinity ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ I can't say, "Give me one chunk of memory from one NUMA node and another chunk from a different NUMA node." (I'm led to understand this is desirable to increase total memory throughput, or something.) You could do this using `Granular Resource Request Syntax`_ and `Traits`_, but you would have to identify *specific* NUMA nodes, which is only practical if your systems are homogeneous with respect to the number of NUMA nodes. So for example, tag providers with ``CUSTOM_NUMA_1`` and ``CUSTOM_NUMA_2`` and then use a flavor containing: .. code:: resources1:MEMORY_MB=1024 trait1:CUSTOM_NUMA_1=required resources2:MEMORY_MB=1024 trait2:CUSTOM_NUMA_2=required .. _`multi-same-class`: Multiple same-class resources with affinity ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ For example, in the model above, I can't say, "Give me 2 VCPU, 1GB of memory, *one VF from NET1, and one VF from NET2*, all from the same NUMA node." See `Numbered Request Group Affinity`_ for a possible alternative design that would support this. Distance ~~~~~~~~ I can't say, "Give me an instance with its VCPU fewer than two 'steps' away from its memory," whatever that means. See `Tree Distance`_. Alternatives ------------ The proposed design has the following advantages over the alternatives below: * **It's dead simple.** Simple to implement, simple for virt driver developers to understand and model, simple for admins to understand and build flavors for, simple for operators to understand when looking at those flavors. * **It doesn't require admins/operators to know how the virt driver has modeled its resource providers.** The virt driver can model its ProviderTree(s) in just about any distribution, in deep or shallow hierarchies, etc.; and can even change that structure from release to release. As long as the aggregate associations are made according to the design, all the admin needs to understand is which resource classes can be "affinitized". Numbered Request Group Affinity ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Instead of the value of ``group_resources`` being a list of resource classes, it could be a list of resource groups. Now you can express the example from :ref:`multi-same-class` as: .. code:: resources:VCPU=2 resources:MEMORY_MB=1024 resources1:SRIOV_NET_VF=1 trait1:CUSTOM_NET1=required resources2:SRIOV_NET_VF=1 trait2:CUSTOM_NET2=required group_resources=resources,resources1,resources2 Aside from being slightly harder to implement and understand (by admins/ops), this is still limited to a single grouping. One could imagine "namespacing" ``group_resources`` to overcome this: .. code:: resources1:VCPU=1 resources1:MEMORY_MB=1024 resources2:VCPU=1 resources2:MEMORY_MB=1024 resources3:SRIOV_NET_VF=1 trait3:CUSTOM_NET1=required resources4:SRIOV_NET_VF=1 trait4:CUSTOM_NET2=required resources5:SRIOV_NET_VF=1 trait5:CUSTOM_NET1=required resources6:SRIOV_NET_VF=1 trait6:CUSTOM_NET2=required group_resources:A=resources1,resources3,resources4 group_resources:B=resources2,resources5,resources6 ...which becomes yet harder to implement and understand. That said, this is my favorite alternative, a very close second to the proposed design. Traits ~~~~~~ Tag NUMA nodes with traits, as hinted in `Anti-affinity`_. This has the advantage of being possible as soon as `Nested Resource Providers`_ and `update_provider_tree`_ are fully implemented, without any further coding. But as noted above, this would require the admin to identify resources by their specific NUMA node, which could lead to undesired "packing", etc. Tree Distance ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Express desired "distance" between/among resource classes in terms of how many "steps" it takes in the ProviderTree to get from one to another. For instance, in the `Examples`_ model, ``NIC_PF1_rp`` is zero steps from itself, one step from ``NUMA1_rp``, two steps from ``NIC_PF2_rp`` and ``compute_node_rp``, etc. This is fairly tough to implement. It also requires the admin to have an intimate understanding of how the virt driver has modeled the providers. And I haven't even begun to think about what the flavor syntax would need to look like, but I can only imagine that would be yet more confusing to the operator. Let's Bikeshed the Queryparam Key ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Possible alternatives to ``group_resources``: * ``affine_resources`` * ``aggregate_resources`` * ``resource_affinity`` Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- The placement `list allocation candidates`_ API is modified to accept the :ref:`queryparam` in a new microversion. (We could also implement this in ``GET /resource_providers``, since it supports the ``resources`` queryparam. Is that necessary/desirable? We didn't implement `numbered request group`_ there.) Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- See `Flavor Syntax`_. Developer impact ---------------- See `Virt's Responsibilities`_. Upgrade impact -------------- The new feature will only be available in configurations where both compute and placement support it. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: ? Other contributors: ? Work Items ---------- * Placement API: * New schema and parsing utils for the :ref:`queryparam`. * Appropriate database and/or python filtering of allocation candidates. * Microversion paperwork. * Scheduler: * Parse ``group_requests`` from flavor extra_specs. * Include ``group_requests`` in the `list allocation candidates`_ call (from ``SchedulerReportClient.get_allocation_candidates``). * Virt driver work is out of scope, to be done later by virt drivers wishing to exploit this feature. Dependencies ============ * `Nested Resource Providers`_ * `update_provider_tree`_ Testing ======= * Gabbits for the new API syntax * Functional tests exercising the scheduler side Documentation Impact ==================== * Update the placement API reference to describe the new syntax in `list allocation candidates`_. * Update the `Placement devref`_ to describe the new microversion. * Add admin documentation for the `Flavor Syntax`_. References ========== .. _`Nested Resource Providers`: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/queens/approved/nested-resource-providers.html .. _`Traits`: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/queens/approved/request-traits-in-nova.html .. _`Traits in the GET /allocation_candidates API`: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/queens/approved/add-trait-support-in-allocation-candidates.html .. _`Granular Resource Request Syntax`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540179/ .. _`update_provider_tree`: https://review.openstack.org/540111 .. _`list allocation candidates`: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#list-allocation-candidates .. _`numbered request group`: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/queens/approved/granular-resource-requests.html#numbered-request-groups .. _`Placement devref`: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/placement.html History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Rocky - Introduced

commit_message:
Form Upgrade SIG

As a result of conversations across multiple PTG's and Forums
there is a consensus that a SIG to focus on improving the process
for upgrading OpenStack clouds would be a good idea.

Change-Id: Ic60aaa5b993a35de5103b93375784accee7a4fbe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance-sigs refs/changes/03/548203/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Upgrade: chairs: - name: James Page irc: jamespage email: james.page@canonical.com - name: Lee Yarwood irc: lyarwood email: lee.yarwood@redhat.com - name: Luo Lujin irc: luolujin email: luo.lujin@jp.fujitsu.com scope: > The objective of the Upgrade SIG is to improve the overall upgrade process for OpenStack Clouds, covering both offline 'fast-forward' upgrades and online 'rolling' upgrades, by providing a forum for cross-project collaboration between operators and developers to document and codify best practice for upgrading OpenStack. status: active url: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Upgrade_SIG

during the Rocky PTG for the First Contact SIG.

commit_message:
Remove now unused jobs from various sahara repositories

Most of jobs from sahara, sahara-tests, python-saharaclient have been
migrated. Keep the ones still not ported (grenade) or not working
(multinode) as Zuul v3.

The native jobs works on stable/pike, stable/queens and master.
Ocata is going out of support in few days
and a last release for Sahara was tagged few days ago.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/546695
Change-Id: I72e9e6ea9d612a40085635544215f89d9b75053e

deleted_lines: - hosts: all name: Autoconverted job legacy-sahara-buildimages-ambari-centos-7 from old job gate-sahara-buildimages-ambari-centos-7-nv tasks: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x CLONEMAP=`mktemp` function cleanup { # In cases where zuul-cloner is aborted during a git # clone operation, git will remove the git work tree in # its cleanup. commit_message:
Make combined and correct acls for openstacksdk team

The shade and sdk teams have merged, but the original implementation of
this in the ACLs was to just make openstacksdk-core include shade-core.
os-client-config has also been merged, and requestsexceptions is a
deliverable of the team too.

Go ahead and collapse them into a single acl file and apply it to all
the projects. Also remove the -release team as openstacksdk is release
managed.

Update the ACL file to match what it should be for a release-managed
project, including stable-maint and branch-release teams.

Update the description - that wiki page isn't really a thing we
care about.

Change-Id: I45364a382fbed7bbadbecd29aa6ff051fecdb895

commit_message:
Fix up amulet for queens

* Fix up amulet tests to use keystone v3 clients.
* Remove admin_* and auth_* for Queens l3_agent and metadata
  config files as they no longer appears to be used.
* charm helper sync

Change-Id: I880b7f710fa6b5ba480fb41d4095871fd9dabed7

subject: Fix broken validations on stack update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-23 12:39:38.000000000', 'files': ['workbooks/validations.yaml', 'tripleo_common/actions/validations.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/8ceb4e2b78f8dd091faa73304db534bd87d21f45', 'message': 'Fix broken validations on stack update

Patch I3be30ed8bb61d8ed514991a2f55c5c4e36c56411 fixed a confusing
message on initial deploy (bug #1703942) but broke stack update for
cases when there are no extra free nodes available (even though they
are not needed).

This patch reverts the earlier one and fixes the confusing message in
an alternative way -- we first validate available node count (a
validation for this already exists), and only if it succeeds we
proceed to validate the availability of nodes matching particular
flavors.

Change-Id: I91ddc03e5ac22494f5276f08f87011074483d5c6
Closes-Bug: #1745997
Related-Bug: #1703942
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken validations on stack update

Patch I3be30ed8bb61d8ed514991a2f55c5c4e36c56411 fixed a confusing
message on initial deploy (bug #1703942) but broke stack update for
cases when there are no extra free nodes available (even though they
are not needed).

This patch reverts the earlier one and fixes the confusing message in
an alternative way -- we first validate available node count (a
validation for this already exists), and only if it succeeds we
proceed to validate the availability of nodes matching particular
flavors.

Change-Id: I91ddc03e5ac22494f5276f08f87011074483d5c6
Closes-Bug: #1745997
Related-Bug: #1703942

commit_message:
Remove newton job from projects pipeline

newton is EOL now and tempest has newton jobs
running on check pipeline as voting.

d-g also have newton job running.

Tempest also going to mark end of support of newton
in Tempest (Depends-On patch).

Though newton EOl cleanup is pending on job side
but let's remove these from tempest and d-g pipeline
where tempest has this job voting and can cause issue
if no newton branches etc.

This commit also remove below job as there is no stable/newton branch
in Tempest so it does not run anywhere.
- legacy-tempest-dsvm-nnet-newton

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546906/
Change-Id: I69a6af9f79606c02d898c5d76c92c60ed17bd5fa

commit_message:
make add_release_notes_links.sh smarter

When everything is fine, say so.

When the project doesn't publish any release notes at all, don't
report that the series page is missing.

Change-Id: I122675d63c45a643af74a62ee42de1977ddc9ea6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/59/548659/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo -n "$deliverable " base="https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/${deliverable}" main_url="${base}/index.html" if ! url_exists $main_url; then echo "no notes at all, skipping" continue fi series_url="${base}/${SERIES}.html" if ! url_exists $series_url; then echo "no release notes page at $series_url" echo "OK" edit-deliverable $SERIES $deliverable set-release-notes "$series_url"
deleted_lines: echo -n $deliverable url="https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/${deliverable}/${SERIES}.html" if ! url_exists $url; then echo " no release notes page at $url" echo edit-deliverable $SERIES $deliverable set-release-notes "$url"

commit_message:
set up logging for propose-final-releases

Several of the support modules now use logging exclusively as a way to
emit debug info. Set up logging so we can see that debug info when
--verbose is turned on.

Change-Id: I029b6cc8667fca61f70afd19e99dd865870a546e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/39/547539/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Skip diff-start for first final release tagging

Handles the case where it is the first release of a deliverable.
Instead of adding 'none' as the diff-start, this just skips
adding the setting to the release.

Change-Id: I66fd4ef165165689cb6d2b6613c45b3564330a8f

commit_message:
un-EOL Ocata

In the release-cycles/Support length discussion at the PTG we (mostly)
all agreeed to keep Ocata around for another 6 months so remove the EOL
tag and set the clock ticking.

It looks strange that we only extended Ocata but it's the first step in
a longer process that will probably still be on-going at the Berlin
summit

Change-Id: Ib09b27eff0e6ef94ddf4a1f6291b16b4a1b40c8c

commit_message:
Add more usage hints

Since there's already a hint on how to tell the bot to book a room,
and some people have been slightly struggling with updating track
info, add a couple of hints making it more obvious how to do this
without having to consult a larger README.rst.  This should hopefully
encourage more people to help keep track info up to date.

Also include a link to the nicely rendered version of README.rst on
GitHub, so that if people are looking for more detailed help, they can
easily find it.

Change-Id: I3596d69dc84b635bc3a67ff7223a7ccfad27308e

commit_message:
use common agent topics from neutron-lib

The neutron.common.topics module was rehomed into neutron-lib with
commit Ie88b84949cbd55a4e7ad06341aab77b286cdc485
This patch consumes it by using neutron-lib's version of the module in
prep for Ia4a4604c259ce862597de80c6deeb3d408bf0e95

Change-Id: Ibcb76290f46d4fcf82ba62bb2e1694f98fffa13e

commit_message:
Define devstack-base abstract job

Define an abstract job devstack base that does not require any
project apart from devstack. This job defines basic devstack_localrc
settings that are common to any devstack job (mostly to work with
infra) and devstack_services to emit "disable_all_services" so to
cancel any devstack default.

The variables are defined as global ones as well as host-vars for
the controller and group-vars for peer nodes, so that any
descendent job may extend them, thanks for Zuul dict merging.

Change-Id: I2cdb723f6ee209683044fecec59ff7b510a2752b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/00/548100/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: peers nodes: - compute1 name: devstack-base abstract: true description: | Base abstract Devstack job. Defines plays and base variables, but it does not include any project and it does not run any service by default. This is a common base for all single Devstack jobs, single or multinode. Variables are defined in job.vars, which is what is then used by single node jobs and by multi node jobs for the controller, as well as in job.group-vars.peers, which is what is used by multi node jobs for peer nodes (everything but the controller). vars: devstack_localrc: &base_devstack_localrc base: false group-vars: peers: devstack_locarlrc: *base_devstack_localrc devstack_services: base: false name: devstack parent: devstack-base description: | Single node devstack job for integration gate. nodeset: openstack-single-node required-projects: - openstack/cinder - openstack/glance - openstack/keystone - openstack/neutron - openstack/nova - openstack/requirements - openstack/swift timeout: 7200 vars: test_matrix_configs: [neutron, tlsproxy] devstack_localrc: # Common OpenStack services settings SWIFT_REPLICAS: 1 SWIFT_START_ALL_SERVICES: false SWIFT_HASH: 1234123412341234 CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL: 10 DEBUG_LIBVIRT_COREDUMPS: True NOVA_VNC_ENABLED: true VNCSERVER_LISTEN: 0.0.0.0 VNCSERVER_PROXYCLIENT_ADDRESS: "{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname]['nodepool']['private_ipv4'] }}" devstack_services: horizon: false tempest: false - job: parent: devstack-base
deleted_lines: name: devstack parent: multinode description: Base devstack job nodeset: openstack-single-node - openstack/cinder - openstack/glance - openstack/keystone - openstack/neutron - openstack/nova - openstack/requirements - openstack/swift timeout: 7200 vars: test_matrix_configs: [neutron, tlsproxy] devstack_localrc: Q_USE_DEBUG_COMMAND: true FLOATING_HOST_PREFIX: 172.24.4 FLOATING_HOST_MASK: 23 SWIFT_REPLICAS: 1 SWIFT_START_ALL_SERVICES: false SWIFT_HASH: 1234123412341234 horizon: false tempest: false summary: True parent: devstack

commit_message:
Restore NEUTRON_CREATE_INITIAL_NETWORKS flag

Somehow this feature was lost in the transition
from q-svc to neutron-api. This patch does not
modify the default behavior but allows specifying
the flag to false to prevent devstack from creating
the public and private networks.

Change-Id: I952672496d007552c0c4d83db0d0df9be50326fc
Signed-off-by: Josh <jhershbe@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove ShardRange.create() method

Since [1] this method became in appropriate other than in
tests. Replacing it is simpler than relocating it to the test tree.

[1] Related-Change: I8cf5d72a9256ee2bae141ebdb892db2cb578f39a

Change-Id: I9be66b1dae5d9498a0c955279b1aa7713a9a19b3

commit_message:
set network-feature-enabled.port_security to True

tempest.api.volume.test_volumes_snapshots.VolumesSnapshotTestJSON.
test_snapshot_create_offline_delete needs port_security feature.
In tempest, It is disabled by default. We need to enable in order
to run this tests.

Change-Id: I63e4cb2ff7a9af3d1d16f57c9e4245e4b0f92395
Closes-Bug: #1753370
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/91/549691/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
XenAPI: provide VGPU_DISPLAY_HEAD inventory in compute node

XenAPI reports the max_display_heads in vgpu_stats. This commit
is to create inventory data for vGPU display heads in compute
node, so that we can support scheduling resource providers basing
on the VGPU_DISPLAY_HEAD.
The total vGPU display heads = (max heads per vGPU) * total_vgpus

blueprint: add-support-for-vgpu

Change-Id: I6862ce67c7ae62fbea5816075c16b7e428e1c36e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/42/523342/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_vgpu_inventory(self, vgpu_stats): vgpu_inv = {} total_vgpus = 0 total_heads = 0 heads_per_vgpu = 0 if vgpu_stats: grps = list(vgpu_stats.keys()) grp_size = len(grps) grp_info = vgpu_stats[grps[0]] total_per_grp = grp_info['total'] heads_per_vgpu = grp_info['max_heads'] total_vgpus = total_per_grp * grp_size total_heads = heads_per_vgpu * total_vgpus if total_vgpus > 0: # Only create inventory for vGPU when driver can supply vGPUs. # At the moment, XenAPI can support up to one vGPU per VM, # so max_unit is 1. vgpu_inv[fields.ResourceClass.VGPU] = { 'total': total_vgpus, 'min_unit': 1, 'max_unit': 1, 'step_size': 1, } if total_heads > 0: # If this GPU group supports display heads, we also create # inventory data for it. The allocation granularity is # *heads_per_vgpu*. vgpu_inv[fields.ResourceClass.VGPU_DISPLAY_HEAD] = { 'total': total_heads, 'min_unit': heads_per_vgpu, 'max_unit': heads_per_vgpu, 'step_size': heads_per_vgpu, } return vgpu_inv vgpu_inv = self._get_vgpu_inventory(host_stats['vgpu_stats']) if vgpu_inv: # Associate vGPU's inventory data to compute node. result.update(vgpu_inv)
deleted_lines: def _get_vgpu_total(self, vgpu_stats): total = 0 for grp_id in vgpu_stats: total += vgpu_stats[grp_id]['total'] return total vgpus = self._get_vgpu_total(host_stats['vgpu_stats']) if vgpus > 0: # Only create inventory for vGPU when driver can supply vGPUs. # At the moment, XenAPI can support up to one vGPU per VM, # so max_unit is 1. result.update( { fields.ResourceClass.VGPU: { 'total': vgpus, 'min_unit': 1, 'max_unit': 1, 'step_size': 1, } } )

commit_message:
Update role SHA's to include additional fixes

There've been some role updates since the last SHA bump. To
ensure that these are available in the next (and possibly
final) release, we update the SHA's to the latest.

Change-Id: I62436ad46a1ca672b39812a3370e768cdb2c9c92

commit_message:
Remove jenkins-slave element from DIB images

There is no jenkins, only zuul! With zuulv3 running in production,
there is no more need to add jenkins user or scripts to our images.

Move chmod of /opt/cache/files from
nodepool/elements/jenkins-slave/install.d/20-jenkins-slave to
nodepool/elements/zuul-worker/install.d/60-zuul-worker

We also leave the jenkins-slave elements for now, in case 3rd party CI
use them.

Change-Id: Ia9750877fbc1a17ec467ca4ac685afdb9c1627f8
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Good bye jenkins/scripts

We now only have afs-slug.sh in jenkins/scripts/ and it is only
used by nodepool/scripts/configure_mirror.sh. Move the file into the
nodepool/scripts directory and adjust paths.

Remove copying of jenkins/scripts from nodepool, the directory does not
exist anymore.

Remove 89-jenkins-scripts, we don't need it anymore.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/548393
Change-Id: I13cac791d70a2e5bcb0de1ba0adcd79e1b0aee9f

commit_message:
Enable py35 unit test job

To enable py35 for the functional test job, we'll first
need to move legacy-osc-placement-dsvm-functional in-tree
and then we can copy it and enable py35.

Change-Id: I81f62f24996522fd4a16c8486920795bc221495d

commit_message:
Remove unused nodepool ready-scripts

We no longer have the ability to run ready-scripts in nodepool, so
let's delete / clean them up.

Change-Id: I2551037dcfba2362d23401536295eb8f8f5d3e0d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/40/548240/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash -xe # Copyright (C) 2014 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/sbin for ip in $(cat /etc/nodepool/primary_node /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes /etc/nodepool/primary_node_private /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private | sort -u); do # Check for ipv6 address. if echo $ip | grep -q :; then sudo ip6tables -I openstack-INPUT 1 -s $ip -j ACCEPT else sudo iptables -I openstack-INPUT 1 -s $ip -j ACCEPT fi done echo "" >> /home/jenkins/.ssh/authorized_keys cat /etc/nodepool/id_rsa.pub >> /home/jenkins/.ssh/authorized_keys echo "" >> /home/jenkins/.ssh/authorized_keys ROLE=$(cat /etc/nodepool/role) if [ $ROLE == "primary" ]; then cp /etc/nodepool/id_rsa /home/jenkins/.ssh/id_rsa chmod 0600 /home/jenkins/.ssh/id_rsa else rm /etc/nodepool/id_rsa fi sudo chown -R root:root /etc/nodepool sudo chmod 0755 /etc/nodepool sudo chmod 0444 /etc/nodepool/* /opt/nodepool-scripts/configure_mirror.sh

commit_message:
Run local script after nova cellsv2 is configured

If user try to create a server in local script before nova cells is
configured, it will run into the following error:
Host 'x' is not mapped to any cell.

commit_message:
Update nova api_class setting to backend

Castellan switches the `api_class` config option to `backend`. The change
is still backwards compatible with the old `api_class` setting, but cinder
already updated to use the new option (see I5e46c738531d5d56777e91a00f4cee9531356f2e)
and it is better to use the new setting.

Change-Id: Ib609c82e7076d19676baaf4f08abd79ea11db0e3

commit_message:
Increse api_max_retries and api_retry_interval for ironic

There is no way to upgrade ironic before nova because of
grenade design. In multinode job we do not restart nova
as we test partial upgrade of ironic there.
On slow nodes upgrading ironic takes time and nova looses
ironic connectivity

This patch increases api_retry_interval and api_max_retries
to make sure we have a time to upgrade ironic before nova
compute stuck.

Change-Id: I3b1429d6561431a82edda04a0e574cac38771837

commit_message:
Move platform jobs to zuulv3 native

We've called the jobs that don't run on our main Ubuntu targets
"platform" jobs; start at moving these jobs to native jobs.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/541010

Change-Id: Ib64d91206a9ac677f4d77873bc54c6a84702d6c3

commit_message:
Run swift-container-sync under run_process

All the evidence from [1] suggests that on opensuse swift-init is not
detaching the daemon process correctly.  It's possible there's a pipe
still in play that somehow holds our ansible-streamer open.

This is a minimal fix to avoid swift-init.  Although it's possible in
non-default paths to still use swift-init (and hence possibly hit
another variant of this issue), after discussions with swift
developers it was decided the intersection of tests running under our
current ansible, on suse, that would enable these services is
sufficiently small that this is the best course for now.

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001528

Change-Id: I1b68c08c07cf6653ea58506f738cbe0054b38f3a

commit_message:
Move release-tools out of jenkins/scripts

To not install these on the images, create a new scripts directory to
hold them.

Create new copy-release-tools-scripts role to copy the files over,
we do not need using legacy-copy-project-config-scripts anymore since
everything is copied elsewhere.

Add the role to all playbooks that use release-tools scripts.

Change-Id: I36c458e297fec58023799f625739b341c4d403cf

commit_message:
ScaleIO Driver: Document support for ScaleIO 2.5

Add newly released version of ScaleIO to the list of
supported versions within the Configuration Guide. While there
simplify the document to refer to official ScaleIO docs for
any specifics.

commit_message:
Don't load config from github projects

These could wedge our config if we aren't careful, and we aren't
loading jobs from them right now, so be as conservative as possible.

Change-Id: I23bea968875ecb12f8cec5f81277cf3f3071f4f8

commit_message:
Add kubernetes-incubator/kubespray into zuul tenant

The k8s-sig would like to experiment with the idea of creating a base
job to install kubernetes.  By adding kubernetes-incubator/kubespray
to zuul's configuration, we'll be able to run their playbooks / roles
directly from a zuul-executor.

Change-Id: If2ea5f4211d1bca00e35b641e17f1e958079beb3
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Use deterministic shard names, use configured account prefix
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-02 09:41:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/dfa51e2517e84752e92ff2ad0a10468fbc563f70', 'message': 'WIP use deterministic shard names

TODO: unit tests, docstring changes, plumb account prefix from config

Before, shard range container names were based on their upper bound. Now
they are based on their index so that any process finding N shard ranges
in potentially dissimilar replicas of a container will use the same shard
continer names.

Change-Id: I8cf5d72a9256ee2bae141ebdb892db2cb578f39a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-03 10:19:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/79e6855bef987d1043281c02e84aea98cf9cb009', 'message': "Use deterministic shard names, use configured account prefix

Before, shard range container names were based on their upper
bound. Now they are based on their index so that any process finding N
shard ranges in potentially dissimilar replicas of a container will
use the same shard container names.

Before, the shard containers' account prefix was fixed as
'.sharded_'. Now it is '<prefix>shards_' where <prefix> is the
configurable autocreate account prefix.

Usually only one process would be expected to find shard
ranges. However, if more than one process is finding shard ranges
then, assuming they are using the same epoch and shard range number,
they will now create the same shard range containers. Each process is
likely to select different bounds for those shard ranges, but boundary
disputes can be resolved during replication. The fact that each
process created the same shard container means that only object rows
close to boundaries will need to be relocated.

A shard container name has the form:

  <root-container-name>-H(parent-container-name)-<epoch>-<index>

where H is the md5 hash function.

The hash of the parent container is included to differentiate shards
of shard-x and shard-y if shard-x and shard-y were to be sharded at
the same epoch.

For example, the second shard range of a root container named 'foo'
would have container name:

  shard-name = foo-H(foo)-<epoch>-1

The third shard-range of that shard would have name:

  foo-H(shard-name)-<epoch>-2

Change-Id: I8cf5d72a9256ee2bae141ebdb892db2cb578f39a
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-03 10:32:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/d723dafe23c2cbf41cf47fb9baa325926ceb009e', 'message': "Use deterministic shard names, use configured account prefix

commit_message:
Use deterministic shard names, use configured account prefix

Before, shard range container names were based on their upper
bound. Now they are based on their index so that any process finding N
shard ranges in potentially dissimilar replicas of a container will
use the same shard container names.

Before, the shard containers' account prefix was fixed as
'.sharded_'. Now it is '<prefix>shards_' where <prefix> is the
configurable autocreate account prefix.

Usually only one process would be expected to find shard
ranges. However, if more than one process is finding shard ranges
then, assuming they are using the same epoch and shard range number,
they will now create the same shard range containers. Each process is
likely to select different bounds for those shard ranges, but boundary
disputes can be resolved during replication. The fact that each
process created the same shard container means that only object rows
close to boundaries will need to be relocated.

A shard container name has the form:

  <root-container-name>-H(parent-container-name)-<epoch>-<index>

where H is the md5 hash function.

The hash of the parent container is included to differentiate shards
of shard-x and shard-y if shard-x and shard-y were to be sharded at
the same epoch.

For example, the second shard range of a root container named 'foo'
would have container name:

  shard-name = foo-H(foo)-<epoch>-1

The third shard-range of that shard would have name:

  foo-H(shard-name)-<epoch>-2

Change-Id: I8cf5d72a9256ee2bae141ebdb892db2cb578f39a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/41/549141/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: index = len(existing_ranges) {'index': index, 'lower': last_shard_upper, 'upper': next_shard_upper, 'object_count': shard_size}) index += 1
deleted_lines: ShardRange.create(self.root_account, self.root_container, last_shard_upper, next_shard_upper, object_count=shard_size, state=ShardRange.FOUND) )

commit_message:
Move instance attribute defined into "__init__" method

1. Define instance attribute in instance method is not a good idea,
when invoke the method, it will set attribute, it is unnecessary,
this ps move the attribute defined into __init__ method, and
and let the list_engines() just list the engines.
2. Update the description of EngineManager.

Change-Id: I3c9af9cf265cb44d6db4d2f3690b6ddb92fdd61e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/73/545273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.engines = self.list_engines() if self.engine_name not in self.engines:
deleted_lines: self.engines = [] engines = self.list_engines() if self.engine_name not in engines: self.engines = engines

subject: Fix nova db post setup tasks to remove race
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-01 11:26:56.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/3195e631faecefe38780641fc0bd53218c1b42a8', 'message': 'Fix nova db post setup tasks to remove race

If the nova_db_post_setup.yml task is delegated to the same conductor
host for multiple compute hosts, the tasks run in parallel. If the
nova_db_post_setup.yml task is delegated to different conductor hosts,
the tasks run in serial. When the tasks run in parallel this creates a
race condition which can cause the "Perform a cell_v2 discover" task to
fail due to multiple tasks attempting to make the same changes to the
database.

The tasks in nova_db_post_setup.yml should only need to be run once for
the new compute hosts, not for each one. This change limits the tasks to
running once to prevent the possibility of conflicting database
changes being attempted.

Change-Id: I216d781f129d4d56ad10405b9f4a55f7a3fd597a
Closes-bug: 1752540
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova db post setup tasks to remove race

If the nova_db_post_setup.yml task is delegated to the same conductor
host for multiple compute hosts, the tasks run in parallel. If the
nova_db_post_setup.yml task is delegated to different conductor hosts,
the tasks run in serial. When the tasks run in parallel this creates a
race condition which can cause the "Perform a cell_v2 discover" task to
fail due to multiple tasks attempting to make the same changes to the
database.

The tasks in nova_db_post_setup.yml should only need to be run once for
the new compute hosts, not for each one. This change limits the tasks to
running once to prevent the possibility of conflicting database
changes being attempted.

Change-Id: I216d781f129d4d56ad10405b9f4a55f7a3fd597a
Closes-bug: 1752540

commit_message:
Close out queens in glance-specs repo

Update queens specs from 'approved' to 'implemented' or to
rocky/approved or to untargeted, define the redirects, and
make appropriate changes on the supporting pages.

Change-Id: I48aa6a2f11831ffc544e8b02b0bfdb80aa51d3e2

commit_message:
Provide service domain id for v3 deployments

The glance swift store configuration requires use of the domain
id for the service domain; update data set for identity-service
relation to include service_domain_id.

Change-Id: Ie6e2733f34de10a4d34b18dbf1fd9ba623af0e18
Closes-Bug: 1752027

commit_message:
Remvoved OvS2.5 specific changes as it is no longer required

In pike release, we have migrated manifests from ovs2.5 to ovs2.6 and
retained the backward compatibility. Removing the ovs2.5 changes
in this cycle as it is no longer used.

Change-Id: I286b2f4d090dda34ec95f24f77baefcb7687ff85

commit_message:
Allow configuring the new notifier settings

This change adds four new parameters for the new notifier added in the
Mistral Rocky release.

Change-Id: I005a49d21842661e944f45d44f08bf6bcec0a2a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-mistral refs/changes/70/549270/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'mistral::notifier' do shared_examples_for 'mistral notifier' do it 'configure notifier default params' do is_expected.to contain_mistral_config('notifier/type').with_value('<SERVICE DEFAULT>') is_expected.to contain_mistral_config('notifier/host').with_value('<SERVICE DEFAULT>') is_expected.to contain_mistral_config('notifier/topic').with_value('<SERVICE DEFAULT>') is_expected.to contain_mistral_config('notifier/notify').with_value('<SERVICE DEFAULT>') end context 'with specific parameters' do let :params do { :type => "remote", :host => "localhost", :topic => "mistral-event-stream", :notify => "[{'type': 'noop'}]", } end it 'configure notifier params' do is_expected.to contain_mistral_config('notifier/type').with_value('remote') is_expected.to contain_mistral_config('notifier/host').with_value('localhost') is_expected.to contain_mistral_config('notifier/topic').with_value('mistral-event-stream') is_expected.to contain_mistral_config('notifier/notify').with_value("[{'type': 'noop'}]") end end end on_supported_os({ :supported_os => OSDefaults.get_supported_os }).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) do facts.merge!(OSDefaults.get_facts()) end it_configures 'mistral notifier' end end end

commit_message:
Models are no longer 'types'

In jsonmodels, the metaclass for models was changed. Therefore, a model
is no longer a type. Checks of the form type(x) == type fail, and are
replaced with inspect.isclass(x).

Change-Id: Ib8de32e47db8b44735c95b552835ce85b24e2b88
Closes-Bug: #1753244

commit_message:
Fix manila endpoint in catalog not find error

This issue occurs when we list share without add manilav1 endpoint,
there will be "could not find Manila endpoint in catalog".

Since manilav1 has been deprecated for a couple of releases, so there
is no need to add manilav1 endpoint when using manila v2 API.

This change is to fix it without add manilav1 endpoint, we can also
perform manila command with manilav2 endpoint when using manila v2
API.

Change-Id: I68b499e153e1aba3a5a285f07d71e31b6af65bca
Closes-Bug: #1558995
Closes-Bug: #1734016

added_lines: # openSUSE Tumblweed is a rolling release model distribution, so it has # no version - set it to tumbleweed if [ "$OS_TYPE" = "opensuse" ] && [[ "$PRETTY_NAME" =~ "Tumbleweed" ]]; then OS_VERSION="tumbleweed" fi

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary distribution determination

The need for the distribution was removed in I249f21a98fea3b963b7ffb8e3d0fce02cc540d46
so we can remove the code around that was determining it but not
actually making use of it anywhere anymore.

Change-Id: I572943bbc0c2665a885b7a80cdb2d1817c61bc3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/75/549075/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: import sys# this is a bit weird; we want to get the filter to use on the # devstack lib/[apt|rpm] files to pre-install them. So we have to # swizzle things around RELEASE = None if 'DIB_RELEASE' in os.environ: RELEASE = os.environ['DIB_RELEASE'] try: if open(os.path.join( TMP_MOUNT_PATH, 'etc/redhat-release')).read().startswith('CentOS release 6'): # not actually used in devstack, but for consistency and because this # script will error if run on a platform where RELEASE isn't detected # as something RELEASE = 'rhel6' except IOError: pass if 'DISTRO_NAME' in os.environ: if os.environ['DISTRO_NAME'] == 'centos7': # centos7 matches as rhel7 in devstack RELEASE = 'rhel7' if not RELEASE: print("Can not determine RELEASE") sys.exit(1) def local_prep(distribution): branches = local_prep(RELEASE)

This patch will ensure that the rabbitmq password is no longer

enabled by looking for the rabbitmq key and not printing it.

There should likely be an effort to utilize Oslo's secret flag for

Change-Id: I97cc88354d9b54057350c70c4742055197540d1a
Closes-Bug: 1750074
(cherry picked from commit 05e4f14ea1fbc7ce61c8f57a082080d09c63e357)

commit_message:
Fix manila logging rabbitmq password in debug mode

Manila will display the rabbitmq password if debugging is enabled.
This patch will ensure that the rabbitmq password is no longer
displayed in the connection log for Manila when debugging is
enabled by looking for the rabbitmq key and not printing it.

There should likely be an effort to utilize Oslo's secret flag for
options to truly fix this issue for this and other sensitive options.

Change-Id: I97cc88354d9b54057350c70c4742055197540d1a
Closes-Bug: 1750074
(cherry picked from commit 05e4f14ea1fbc7ce61c8f57a082080d09c63e357)
(cherry picked from commit be8580b350c34c91494cb553eb15e6b61ef250b7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/96/549596/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - rabbitmq password is no longer exposed in the logs when debugging is enabled.

commit_message:
Update pypowervm min to 1.1.11

1.1.11 is required for a proposed PowerVM virt driver change [1].

This version also removes the dependency on networkx [2] as a
necessary step toward OpenStack supporting networkx 2.0 [3].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541387
[2] https://github.com/powervm/pypowervm/issues/4
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-requirements/+bug/1718576

Change-Id: I9932168c93fb53498fdcd093f8c5f42e35870dd4

commit_message:
Add reno for manila generic driver removal

A recent change [1] removed dysfunctional environment templates
for manila with the "generic" back end.  Add a release note for
same.

[1] I2e1db2bd614eae65e59712f50dc3391f16f6b388

Change-Id: Iaca0250361055d5175fc93814334cd393e959395
(cherry picked from commit ee0521b25a8411fcf00b651b8f50567dac1b0f82)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/18/546018/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | As documented in launchpad bug 1708680 the templates for manila with the "generic" back end do not yield a successful manila deployment even if they do not cause the overall overcloud deployment to fail, so we are dropping these faulty and unmaintained manila "generic" back end templates.

commit_message:
Add base kit scenario

This scenario includes only the base compute kit (and haproxy),
consisting of: Glance, Keystone, Neutron, Nova and Cinder.

Change-Id: I40e6901ef116b3f4a8d24ad1851327d83a56323e
(cherry picked from commit 72f46e7464c4e4ebfdba2e43492115631a5efc6b)

commit_message:
Run the specified set of tests in grenade-multinode job

This patch defines the specified set of tests & runs these during
upgrade in grenade-multinode job.

Change-Id: I99fa1717f4bf46afc8dd989a3aae129e5c4ab9d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/29/542629/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function _write_heat_integrationtests { local upgrade_tests=$1 cat > $upgrade_tests <<EOF heat_tempest_plugin.tests.api heat_integrationtests.functional.test_autoscaling.AutoScalingSignalTest.test_scaling_meta_update heat_integrationtests.functional.test_autoscaling.AutoscalingGroupBasicTest.test_basic_create_works heat_integrationtests.functional.test_autoscaling.AutoscalingGroupBasicTest.test_group_suspend_resume heat_integrationtests.functional.test_autoscaling.AutoscalingGroupBasicTest.test_size_updates_work heat_integrationtests.functional.test_autoscaling.AutoscalingGroupBasicTest.test_update_group_replace heat_integrationtests.functional.test_autoscaling.AutoscalingGroupBasicTest.test_update_instance_error_causes_group_error heat_integrationtests.functional.test_autoscaling.AutoscalingGroupUpdatePolicyTest.test_instance_group_update_replace heat_integrationtests.functional.test_cancel_update.CancelUpdateTest.test_cancel_update_server_with_port heat_integrationtests.functional.test_create_update.CreateStackTest.test_create_rollback heat_integrationtests.functional.test_create_update.UpdateStackTest.test_stack_in_place_update heat_integrationtests.functional.test_create_update.UpdateStackTest.test_stack_update_add_remove heat_integrationtests.functional.test_create_update.UpdateStackTest.test_stack_update_alias_changes heat_integrationtests.functional.test_create_update.UpdateStackTest.test_stack_update_from_failed heat_integrationtests.functional.test_create_update.UpdateStackTest.test_stack_update_provider heat_integrationtests.functional.test_create_update.UpdateStackTest.test_stack_update_replace heat_integrationtests.functional.test_create_update.UpdateStackTest.test_stack_update_rollback heat_integrationtests.functional.test_create_update.UpdateStackTest.test_stack_update_with_conditions heat_integrationtests.functional.test_create_update.UpdateStackTest.test_stack_update_with_new_env heat_integrationtests.functional.test_instance_group.InstanceGroupBasicTest.test_basic_create_works heat_integrationtests.functional.test_instance_group.InstanceGroupBasicTest.test_create_instance_error_causes_group_error heat_integrationtests.functional.test_instance_group.InstanceGroupBasicTest.test_size_updates_work heat_integrationtests.functional.test_instance_group.InstanceGroupBasicTest.test_update_group_replace heat_integrationtests.functional.test_instance_group.InstanceGroupBasicTest.test_update_instance_error_causes_group_error heat_integrationtests.functional.test_instance_group.InstanceGroupUpdatePolicyTest.test_instance_group_update_replace heat_integrationtests.functional.test_resource_group.ResourceGroupErrorResourceTest.test_fail heat_integrationtests.functional.test_resource_group.ResourceGroupTest.test_create heat_integrationtests.functional.test_resource_group.ResourceGroupTest.test_props_update heat_integrationtests.functional.test_resource_group.ResourceGroupTest.test_resource_group_zero_novalidate heat_integrationtests.functional.test_resource_group.ResourceGroupTest.test_update_increase_decrease_count heat_integrationtests.functional.test_resource_group.ResourceGroupTest.test_update_nochange_resource_needs_update heat_integrationtests.functional.test_resource_group.ResourceGroupTestNullParams.test_create_pass_zero_parameter heat_integrationtests.functional.test_resource_group.ResourceGroupUpdatePolicyTest.test_resource_group_update_scaledown heat_integrationtests.functional.test_resource_group.ResourceGroupUpdatePolicyTest.test_resource_group_update_scaleup heat_integrationtests.functional.test_snapshot_restore.StackSnapshotRestoreTest.test_stack_snapshot_restore heat_integrationtests.functional.test_software_deployment_group.SoftwareDeploymentGroupTest.test_deployment_crud_with_rolling_update heat_integrationtests.functional.test_software_deployment_group.SoftwareDeploymentGroupTest.test_deployments_create_delete_in_progress heat_integrationtests.functional.test_validation.StackValidationTest.test_stack_validate_provider_references_parent_resource heat_tempest_plugin.tests.functional.test_software_config.ParallelDeploymentsTest.test_deployments_metadata heat_tempest_plugin.tests.functional.test_nova_server_networks.CreateServerTest.test_create_server_with_port heat_tempest_plugin.tests.functional.test_nova_server_networks.CreateServerTest.test_create_server_with_subnet_fixed_ip_sec_group heat_tempest_plugin.tests.functional.test_nova_server_networks.CreateServerTest.test_create_update_server_with_subnet EOF } function _clean_integrationtests_env { # Clean environments source $DEST/devstack/openrc demo demo # delete the network created openstack router remove subnet router1 heat-subnet openstack subnet delete heat-subnet openstack network delete heat-net source $DEST/devstack/openrc admin admin # delete the flavors created openstack flavor delete m1.heat_int openstack flavor delete m1.heat_micro # Set Heat environment variables _heat_set_user } function _run_heat_integrationtests { export DEST=$(dirname $devstack_dir) $DEST/heat/heat_integrationtests/prepare_test_env.sh $DEST/heat/heat_integrationtests/prepare_test_network.sh # Run set of specified functional tests UPGRADE_TESTS=upgrade_tests.list _write_heat_integrationtests $UPGRADE_TESTS tox -evenv-tempest -- stestr --test-path=$DEST/heat/heat_integrationtests --top-dir=$DEST/heat --group_regex='heat_tempest_plugin\.tests\.api\.test_heat_api[._]([^_]+)' run --whitelist-file $UPGRADE_TESTS _clean_integrationtests_env # run heat integration tests instead of tempest smoke before create _run_heat_integrationtests $BASE_DEVSTACK_DIR source $TOP_DIR/openrc admin admin _run_heat_integrationtests $TARGET_DEVSTACK_DIR
deleted_lines: function _run_heat_api_tests { sed -i -e '/group_regex/c\group_regex=heat_tempest_plugin\\.tests\\.api\\.test_heat_api(?:\\.|_)([^_]+)' .testr.conf tox -evenv-tempest -- tempest run --regex heat_tempest_plugin.tests.api # run heat api tests instead of tempest smoke before create _run_heat_api_tests $BASE_DEVSTACK_DIR _run_heat_api_tests $TARGET_DEVSTACK_DIR

subject: Clean imports in code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-21 08:35:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork/commit/7e2a2576ae9433c7a0fc7c1101d800de4cae8864', 'message': 'Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I9241f126114beae077079aba5c25c2afda517068

commit_message:
Stop requests-mock jobs for retirement

requests-mock was always a general purpose python library, however as it
was initially developed in the openstack community it was hosted there
to take advantage of the infrastructure.

At this time with its developers spending less time on OpenStack it is
felt that being behind gerrit is limiting contributions (even without
the CLA) as more outside contributions are received by launchpad
attachment than gerrit.

The project will continue development at
https://github.com/jamielennox/requests-mock

Remove the zuul jobs in accordance with:
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

Change-Id: I7e88b9fc68f83b8a37b99e62f207dbd648a114e4

commit_message:
Pass located tests directory in oslo debug

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I94802af0b0877c952c8270bc4129c2a01aa2e40f
Closes-Bug: #1666560

commit_message:
Removes manila-generic-config from TripleO

Generic driver is not intended to be used in real environments
since it introduces a SPOF in the data path. Due to this, it
doesn't make sense and generates confusion to have the environment
file, so in this patch set we simply remove it.

Change-Id: I2e1db2bd614eae65e59712f50dc3391f16f6b388
Closes-Bug: #1708680
(cherry picked from commit 6740f94914606ed02328cd557489afae16c04e20)
(cherry picked from commit 6a25b212da4f40303b40804f8e815edd42add1aa)
